703695f-b.text:
Clinton Street, south from Hamilton Avenue and West 9th Street, showing where the Red Hook Houses--a New York City Housing Authority project--will be erected on the west side of the street (right).
June 9, 1938
P. L. Sperr
(2)
The east side of Clinton Street, viewing south from Hamilton Avenue, showing the changes that have taken place. The building in modernistic design, beyond the taxpayer, is the Clinton Theatre.
September 7, 1940
P. L. Sperr
703695f-b.folder: Clinton Street & Hamilton Avenue, Brooklyn, NY

703692f-a.text:
Clinton Street, east side, north from Hamilton Avenue to Huntington Street. The buildings are being demolished for the widening of the avenue and its reconstruction into Gowanus Parkway, a link
in the Belt Perkway system of highways.
September 7, 1940
L. Snerr
703692f-a.folder: Clinton Street & Hamilton Avenue, Brooklyn, NY

Street.
June 9, 1938.
P. L. Sperr
